awd_titl_txt: Solid-State Deuterium NMR of Adsorbates on Heterogeneous    Catalysts
awd_abstract_narration: This research project, in the Analytical and Surface Chemistry                  Program, will study the interaction of adsorbed molecules with                  heterogeneous catalysts, using solid-state deuterium NMR                        methods at high magnetic fields.  Deuterium and various                         deuterated hydrocarbon molecules will be studied, adsorbed                      primarily on alumina supported platinum and rhodium catalysts.                  Questions concerning hydride exchange, C-H bond activation,                     charge transfer between adsorbate and substrate, and adsorbate                  mobility will be addressed.  In addition, very high field low                   temperature studies of quadrupolar coupling constants will be                   carried out.  An attempt will also be made to obtain an NMR                     spectrum for a monolayer adsorbed on a single crystal metal                     surface.                                                                        %%%                                                                             An understanding of the structure and reactivity of molecules                   adsorbed on the surface of catalytic materials is essential to                  the design and use of heterogeneous catalytic processes.  This                  research program will develop powerful nuclear magnetic                         resonance spectroscopic methods for the determination of the                    structure of adsorbed molecules on catalytic surfaces.  This                    structural information will allow the design and understanding                  of catalytic systems crucial to the chemical industry and to                    pollution abatement technologies.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
